true.prompt: You are considering going back to college for an advanced degree. You visit a prospective university and meet with a guidance counselor. She says you will need some remedial math classes since they are a very selective university, but she can approve the application right now if you want.
outcomes: The extra math classes bring a ton of stress, but after a few years you finally finish your program and graduate. You are now extremely employable.
You decide to apply to a different university which does not require the remedial math classes. It was smooth sailing, and you are marginally more employable.

true.prompt: You are invited to teach a course at the University of Washington about your career. The dean wants you to inspire the undergraduates.
outcomes: The pressure to teach the class is stressful and you are an awkward lecturer. The students don't like you and begin dropping your class. After a few semester, the dean comes to terms with their mistake and asks you to leave. Your career is in shambles.
You decide not to teach because you're enjoying your career and don't want to take the pay cut. As a result, you able to take a nice vacation to Hawaii. Life is good.

false.prompt: Recent developments in technology are starting to render your job obsolete. A coworker approaches you to ask if you want to join 'The Anti-Automation League'. You have heard about the AAL in the news lately but can't remember exactly why.
outcomes: You learn of plans to bomb a robotics company. You are assigned as the getaway driver. The event goes smoothly. You hit a hard pothole while escaping and the truck explodes. There was an explosive in truck bed. When the ambulance arrives, you pretend to be an innocent victim.

You tell your coworker no thanks. A few weeks later, you see a news report that the AAL has bombed a robotics company. Your company's robotic workers are now at least three years delayed and the company has to pay out bonuses to keep their employees, including you.

false.prompt: You visit your local library and see a flyer for a free beginner's Spanish course. You have always wanted to learn a new language but haven't had the time.
outcomes: With a new hobby, you are making new friends and have created a comfortable group of friends. Your stress levels go down. Life is good.

You decide that you want to kepe you free time. One day at work, your boss says that there is a promotion for someone who is able to do the job in Spanish. Sigh. You have missed out on a great opportunity.
